== Edathala (CT) (627979) ==

Edathala (CT) is a town in the [[Aluva]] taluka of [[Ernakulam]] district with an area of 34.99 sq. km. and harbouring 18400 households with total population of 77811 as per the 2011 Census. The district headquarter [[Kakkanad]] is at a distance of 18 km. The state headquarter [[Thiruvananthapuram]] is at a distance of 235 km. Male population is 38454 and female population is 39357. Scheduled Caste population is 7127 and Scheduled Tribes population is 277. Census Location Code of the town is 627979<ref>http://www.censusindia.gov.in/2011census/dchb/DCHB.html</ref>.

Population wise class of the town is Class II (population_total 50,000 to 99,999).
The civic status of the town is 'Census Town'.

The nearest city with population more than 1 lakh is Kochi (m corp. + og)  at a distance of 18 km. The nearest city with population more than 5 lakh is Kochi (m corp. + og)  at a distance of 18 km. Railway station is at Aluva at a distance of 2 km.
